N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 126.3 - Structure access

State Regulations
(a) Electric
utilities shall use fences, barbed wire, or other anti-climbing shields to
limit access to lattice tower power line structures adjacent to school property
or playgrounds sanctioned by municipal authorities or recognized recreational
bodies. (b) Electric utilities may
place anti-climbing shields on lattice tower power line structures not adjacent
to school property or designated playgrounds whenever such shields would
eliminate a significant hazard or at the request of an authorized official. Any
authorized official may petition the commissioner to order an electric utility
to place such shields if his request is refused. (c) No ladder, step, or other intended
climbing device shall be allowed less than eight feet above the ground on any
power line structure except for those placed on wooden poles prior to July 1, 1977. Notes
